title: Elias Bouacida
text:
I am a Ph.D. in economics. I am a decision theorist and experimental economist working on the modeling and the understanding of human behavior. I design experiments and use revealed preference techniques to study various assumptions on individual preferences and utility.
I am currently working as maître de conférence (assistant professor) at the University Paris 8.

Research interests

Decision Theory
Experimental Economics
Behavioral Economics
Public Economics



Education


Paris School of Economics, University Paris 1 Panthéon-Sorbonne
Ph.D. in Economics


Paris, France
2019




Paris School of Economics, école nationale des ponts et chaussées
M.Sc. in Economics


Paris, France
2014




École nationale des ponts et chaussées
M.Eng. in Economics


Champs-sur-Marne, France
2014




Experience


University Paris 8 Vincennes -> Saint-Denis


Saint-Denis, France
September 2021 – present


Maître de conférence (assistant professor)


Lancaster University Management School


Lancaster, United Kingdom
September 2019 – August 2021


M.J. Dormer Post-doctoral fellow


University Paris–Nanterre


Nanterre, France
September 2017 – August 2019


ATER (teaching assistant)


University Paris 1 Panthéon–Sorbonne


Paris, France
September 2014 – August 2017


Contrat doctoral (PhD fellowship)

title: Elias Bouacida’s academic website
text:
Welcome to Elias’ trial at a new academic website. You can find the original one here.
If you are looking for the results of the experiment, please go here.

title: Results from the experiment
text: You can find here results from the experiment carried on by Renaud Foucart and Elias Bouacida.

title: Results from Experiment 3
text: You can find here results from the Experiment 3 carried on by Renaud Foucart and Elias Bouacida.

title: Results from Experiment 1
text:
You can find here the results from Experiment 1 carried on by Renaud Foucart and Elias Bouacida. Remember that 1 point in the experiment is $0.02.
The procedure selected by most participants in the experiment is PROCEDURE XX. The draws of the DC-3 lottery of XX were 2, 8, 3, the variable amount received for participants are:

80 points for a TYPE A participant in the GREEN GROUP;
20 points for a TYPE A participant in the BLUE GROUP;
80 points for a TYPE B participant in the GREEN GROUP;
20 points for a TYPE B participant in the BLUE GROUP.

The DC-2 lottery of XX were 3, 0, so the question selected is the third one. Those who chose the sure amount will receive 9 points, the others 0 points.
